org.sercho.masp.space
Class ReflectiveObjectMatcher

java.lang.Object
  org.sercho.masp.space.ReflectiveObjectMatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, ObjectMatcher
public class ReflectiveObjectMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectMatcher

ReflectiveObjectMatcher compares object per Java reflection. This matcher compares all non-null fields of a template and an object and checks them for equality using multiple EqualityCheckers.

This matcher is able to compare any two objects, and does not require their fields to be objects. However, although primitive types are allowed, please note, that there are no primitive null values. For example, a not initiated integer has the value of 0. For this reason caution is advised while matching primitive fields.

This matcher supports all Numbers, Strings, enums and Iterables.

Author:
Grzegorz Lehmann
See Also:

Method Detail

isMatching

public final <T> boolean isMatching(T template,
                                    T object)
isMatching returns true if template matches object. This interface does not specify what the matching criteria is. Thus, the behaviour of implementing classes should be documented precisely.

Specified by:
isMatching in interface ObjectMatcher
Type Parameters:
T - type of both objects
Parameters:
template - template
object - concrete object
Returns:
boolean - true if objects match according to the criteria of this matcher, false otherwise

addChecker

public final void addChecker(java.lang.Class<?> c,
                             EqualityChecker<?> checker)
addChecker adds a new EqualityChecker, which will be used to match objects of class c.

Parameters:
c - class of objects
checker - checker for objects
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
